DataElement.preferredName: Testicular Cancer AJCC Edition 8 Pathologic Tumor T Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the primary testicular carcinoma based on clinical stage information combined with operative findings, and evidence obtained from pathology review when surgery is the first definitive therapy, using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Malignant Testicular Germ Cell Tumor Pathologic T Stage
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A malignant tumor predominantly affecting young men and often associated with cryptorchidism.  Seminoma is the most frequently seen malignant testicular germ cell tumor, followed by embryonal carcinoma and yolk sac tumor._Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology._One criteria of the TNM staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant tumor predominantly affecting young men and often associated with cryptorchidism.  Seminoma is the most frequently seen malignant testicular germ cell tumor, followed by embryonal carcinoma and yolk sac tumor. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A malignant germ cell tumor that arises from the testis. It predominantly affects young men. Seminoma is the most frequently seen malignant testicular germ cell tumor, followed by embryonal carcinoma and yolk sac tumor.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pathologic; caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CRF standard harmonization. mc 1/31/17

ValueDomain.preferredName: Testicular Carcinoma American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 Pathologic T Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of testicular cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion)._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Testicular Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Testicular Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Testicular cancer in which the tumor invades scrotum with or without lymphovascular invasion. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Testicular Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Testicular cancer in which the tumor invades scrotum with or without lymphovascular invasion. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Testicular Cancer pT3 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Testicular Cancer pT3 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Testicular cancer in which the tumor invades spermatic cord with or without lymphovascular invasion. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Testicular Cancer pT3 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Testicular cancer in which the tumor invades spermatic cord with or without lymphovascular invasion. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Testicular Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Testicular Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Testicular cancer which is limited to testis (including rete testis invasion) with lymphovascular invasion or invades hilar soft tissue or epididymis or penetrates visceral mesothelial layer covering the external surface of tunica albuginea with or without lymphovascular invasion. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Testicular Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Testicular cancer which is limited to testis (including rete testis invasion) with lymphovascular invasion or invades hilar soft tissue or epididymis or penetrates visceral mesothelial layer covering the external surface of tunica albuginea with or without lymphovascular invasion. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Testicular Cancer pT1b TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Testicular Cancer pT1b TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Testicular cancer which is limited to testis (including rete testis invasion) without lymphovascular invasion and is 3 cm or larger in size. This pT1 subclassification applies only to pure seminomas. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Testicular Cancer pT1b TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Testicular cancer which is limited to testis (including rete testis invasion) without lymphovascular invasion and is 3 cm or larger in size. This pT1 subclassification applies only to pure seminomas. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Testicular Cancer pT1a TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Testicular Cancer pT1a TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Testicular cancer which is limited to testis (including rete testis invasion) without lymphovascular invasion and is smaller than 3 cm in size. This pT1 subclassification applies only to pure seminomas. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Testicular Cancer pT1a TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Testicular cancer which is limited to testis (including rete testis invasion) without lymphovascular invasion and is smaller than 3 cm in size. This pT1 subclassification applies only to pure seminomas. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Testicular Cancer pT1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Testicular Cancer pT1 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Testicular cancer which is limited to testis (including rete testis invasion) without lymphovascular invasion. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Testicular Cancer pT1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Testicular cancer which is limited to testis (including rete testis invasion) without lymphovascular invasion. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Testicular Cancer pTis TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Testicular Cancer pTis TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Testicular cancer with a finding of germ cell neoplasia in situ. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Testicular Cancer pTis TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Testicular cancer with a finding of germ cell neoplasia in situ. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Testicular Cancer pT0 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Testicular Cancer pT0 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Testicular cancer with no evidence of primary tumor. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Testicular Cancer pT0 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Testicular cancer with no evidence of primary tumor. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Testicular Cancer pTX TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Testicular Cancer pTX TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Testicular cancer in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Testicular Cancer pTX TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Testicular cancer in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Testicular Cancer Pathologic TNM Finding v8 American Joint Committee on Cancer T Category Category
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of testicular cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system.:A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.:One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).:A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

Concepts.longName: Testicular Cancer Pathologic TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of testicular cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system.
A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).
A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
